Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose address to Citizenship and Immigration Canada
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration appeal regarding genuineness of relationship
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the IAD reasonable in concluding the relationship was entered into primarily for acquiring status under IRPA?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) Regulations
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Inconsistencies in testimony regarding cohabitation, financial support, and immigration knowledge
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove genuine relationship
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant deemed not credible due to history of illegal stays and concealment
Crimes.Legal_Rule: A partnership is invalid if entered primarily for acquiring status under IRPA or is not genuine
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Permanent residence application based on conjugal relationship
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to lack of credible evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach found in procedural fairness
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Testimony on cohabitation, financial interdependence, address non-disclosure
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA and its regulations governing spousal sponsorship
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA Regulations, section related to genuine relationships
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Claimed genuine relationship with Mr. Enright
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, documentary evidence, immigration history
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Overturn IAD decision and allow permanent residence
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA subsection 72(1), sections on genuine relationships
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Misrepresentation and non-compliance with reporting requirements
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Relationship must be genuine and not primarily for status acquisition

Crimes.Crime_Name: Using a false name to avoid removal
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration appeal involving alleged fraudulent relationship
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the IAD reasonable in concluding the relationship was primarily for acquiring status under IRPA?
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal of refusal of permanent residence application
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility due to use of false name and concealment
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimony on cohabitation, employment, legal advice, and immigration conduct
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Regulations – definition of valid spouse/common-law partner
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Use of false name and failure to disclose address
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None noted; court found IAD considered relevant evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Relationship must be genuine, not primarily for status
Crimes.Application_Factor: History of attempts to remain in Canada illegally
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Doubts about genuineness due to deceptive conduct
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Use of false name on official documents (mailbox)
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of genuine emotional and financial relationship
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and administrative law
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural obligations during proceedings
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose true identity and location
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation and failure to comply with removal order

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Appeal of refusal of permanent residence based on relationship
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the IAD reasonable in finding the relationship was primarily for status acquisition?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, section 4(1)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal following refusal of sponsorship application
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility due to immigration history and inconsistent testimony
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, documentation of cohabitation and financial ties
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Regulations – validity of conjugal relationships
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Common-law or conjugal partnership with Canadian citizen
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: History of non-compliance with immigration orders
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Relationship must not be primarily for acquiring status
Crimes.Application_Factor: Repeated attempts to gain legal status despite removal orders
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Suspicions about genuineness due to prior disobedience of removal order
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroborating evidence for cohabitation and shared life
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not directly cited, but conduct implies deception
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural duties during appeal
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to report presence and whereabouts

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Impact of illegal employment on credibility in permanent residence application
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant worked without authorization while attempting to gain status
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national out of status seeking residency
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Engaged in unauthorized employment and multiple status applications
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Based on claimed conjugal relationship with Canadian citizen
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: History of illegal activities affecting credibility
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Deemed not credible due to pattern of rule violations
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Testimony on employment, cohabitation, financial support
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on authorized work and genuine relationships
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Financial records, testimonial consistency, duration of relationship
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Work must be authorized; relationship must be genuine
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of proof of legal employment and joint life
Crimes.Cause_Description: Pattern of illegal stay and work undermining claim of genuine relationship
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA sections on work permits and misrepresentation
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: One-sided financial support, lack of mutual dependency
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Implied through concealment of employment and status
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA, sections related to work authorization and admissibility
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: History of non-compliance casts doubt on relationship genuineness

Crimes.Crime_Name: Immigration fraud through purported relationship for permanent residence.
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Permanent residence application based on alleged conjugal relationship
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the IAD reasonable in concluding the relationship was primarily for acquiring status under IRPA?
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal of refusal of sponsorship application
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility due to immigration history and inconsistencies
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimony on cohabitation, financial support, legal advice
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Regulations – definition of genuine relationship
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: History of immigration violations and one-sided financial support
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to prove relationship was genuine and not for status
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Relationship must be genuine and not primarily for status acquisition
Crimes.Application_Factor: Prior attempts to remain in Canada illegally
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Credibility and reasonableness of IAD findings
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA Regulations on spousal and common-law definitions
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Doubt about genuineness due to bad faith indicators
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony and lack of mutual financial integration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No procedural unfairness alleged or found
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not explicit, but conduct suggests concealment
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Serious concerns due to past behavior and testimony gaps
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimed emotional bond and financial support as proof
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Adherence to procedural rules during IAD hearing
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose full immigration history and address
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation and attempt to circumvent immigration rules
